Detailed Description

Abstract interface to Solvers for under-determined matrix systems.

Different solution methods are embodied via subclass implementations. Depending on the solution method, a single solution Vector may be returned or a set of Vectors that span the solution space. (e.g. MPPseudoInvSolver gives a single solution determined via the Moorse-Penrose pseudo inverse, and FullSpaceSolver gives a set of orthogonal Vectors spanning the solution space)

virtual Matrix robot::control::kinematics::UnderdeterminedSystemSolver::solve (  const Matrix &    A,
const Vector &    b
)  [pure virtual]
 

For Ax=b, solves for the solution(s) x.

Returns:
a Matrix whos columns represent the set of vectors that span a sub-space of the solution space. This could be the entire solution space, or just a single solution (hence column).

Implemented in robot::control::kinematics::FullSpaceSolver.

bool base::Referenced::unreference (    )  const [inline, inherited]
 

Decrement the reference count by one, indicating that a pointer to this object is referencing it. If the refence count goes to zero, it is assumed that this object is nolonger referenced and is automatically deleted.
